chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: 2 <= b_nat
b: Z
Hb: 2 <= b
y: Z
x: Z

Goal:
0 <= y < x -> Pell x y -> {n : nat | x = α (S (S n)) /\ y = α (S n)}

Premises:
Pell = fun x y : Z => x * x - b * x * y + y * y = 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Pell (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Pell_opposite_not : forall x y : Z, y < 0 -> 0 < x -> ~ Pell x y
alpha_fix_3 : forall n : nat, α (S (S n)) = b * α (S n) - α n
alpha_ge_0 : forall n : nat, 0 <= α (S n)
alpha_2lm_minus_j : forall (l m v : nat) (Hv : Z.of_nat v = α (2 + m) - α m) (j : nat), l <> 0%nat -> (j <= m)%nat -> Z2Zp (alpha_SSm_m_neq_0 m Hv) (α (S (2 * l * m - j))) = Z2Zp (alpha_SSm_m_neq_0 m Hv) (expoZ (S l) (-1) * α (S j))
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
binomial_Newton : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x y : X, sum x y = sum y x) -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : X), times a b = times b a -> mscal times one n (sum a b) = msum sum zero (S n) (fun i : nat => mscal sum zero (binomial n i) (times (mscal times one (n - i) a) (mscal times one i b)))
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, (0 < p < q)%nat -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | (a * p + b * q)%nat = (1 + p * q)%nat /\ (a <= q)%nat /\ (b <= p)%nat}}
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
alpha_fix_2 = eq_refl : α 2 = 1
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Pell_sym : forall x y : Z, Pell x y < -> Pell y x
alpha_2 : b = 2 -> forall n : nat, α n = Z.of_nat n - 1
iA = fun n : nat => (- α n, α (1 + n), - α (1 + n), α (2 + n)) : nat -> Z * Z * Z * Z Arguments iA _%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => match y with | 0 => Eq | Z.pos _ => Lt | Z.neg _ => Gt end | Z.pos x' => match y with | Z.pos y' => (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Gt end | Z.neg x' => match y with | Z.neg y' => CompOpp (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Lt end end : Z -> Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qnum x * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden y) < QArith_base.Qnum y * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden x) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Pell_zero_left : forall y : Z, Pell 0 y < -> y = 1 \/ y = -1
alpha_inc : forall n : nat, α n < α (S n)
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
M22plus_comm : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y : M22 R, PL22 Rplus x y = PL22 Rplus y x
mscal_sum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> mscal m u n (m x y) = m (mscal m u n x) (mscal m u n y)
Nat.le_succ_l : forall n m : nat, (S n <= m)%nat < -> (n < m)%nat
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, (m y < m x)%nat -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
alpha_nat_fix_2 : forall n : nat, alpha_nat (S (S n)) = (b_nat * alpha_nat (S n) - alpha_nat n)%nat
Z.max_spec : forall n m : Z, n < m /\ Z.max n m = m \/ m <= n /\ Z.max n m = n
alpha_Pell : forall n : nat, Pell (α (S n)) (α n)
alpha_Z_S : forall n : nat, α (S n) = Z.of_nat (alpha_nat n)
alpha_2lm_plus_j : forall (l m v : nat) (Hv : Z.of_nat v = α (2 + m) - α m) (j : nat), Z2Zp (alpha_SSm_m_neq_0 m Hv) (α (S (2 * l * m + j))) = Z2Zp (alpha_SSm_m_neq_0 m Hv) (expoZ l (-1) * α (S j))
A = fun n : nat => (α (2 + n), - α (1 + n), α (1 + n), - α n) : nat -> Z * Z * Z * Z Arguments A _%nat_scope
Pell_zero_right : forall x : Z, Pell x 0 < -> x = 1 \/ x = -1
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q

Z.mul_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> 0 <= n * m

Z2Nat.inj_le : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> n <= m < -> (Z.to_nat n <= Z.to_nat m)%nat
mscal_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (S n) x = m x (mscal m u n x)
M22_mult_distr_r : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult (PL22 Rplus y u) x = PL22 Rplus (MU22 Rplus Rmult y x) (MU22 Rplus Rmult u x)
